text: Castle Explorer is an educational video game by DK Multimedia, released in 1996 for Windows and Macintosh.https://www.mobygames.com/game/windows/castle- explorer It allows players to discover the innerworkings of a castle structure within a Medieval context. It is based upon the Incredible Cross-Sections: Castle book by illustrator Stephen Biesty and author Richard Platt. The player is a page who is given the task of being a spy to enter the castle and gather information for the king. The Vancouver Sun described it as "compelling, fascinating and informative". Geet Out UK thought it "wove RP and intrigue into the educational content". Feibel said it was "Elaborate, exciting, informative. Mandatory!". Sun Sentinel said the educational content was let down by poor gameplay. Meanwhile, a book that explored the series felt it was a good mix of the two. == References == Category:Educational video games Category:1996 video games Category:Mac OS games Category:Video games developed in the United Kingdom Category:Windows games
